benchmark_details.name: SpaDeLeF: A Dataset for Hierarchical Classification of Lexical Functions for Collocations in Spanish
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a dataset of frequent Spanish verb-noun collocations and sentences where they occur, each assigned to one of 37 defined lexical functions for hierarchical classification.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To contribute to the solution of the problem of lexical resources shortage by building a collection of Spanish verb-noun collocations annotated with lexical functions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is not balanced in terms of the number of sentences and collocations per lexical function.

data.source: The dataset was created using dependency tree parsing of sentences extracted from Spanish newspapers like Excelsior, La Razón, and Público.
data.annotation: Annotated with lexical functions from the Meaning-Text Theory.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on results from the classification tasks across different levels.
methodology.interpretation: Precision indicates the fraction of relevant instances among the retrieved instances; Recall indicates the fraction of relevant instances that were retrieved; F1 Score is the harmonic mean of Precision and Recall.
methodology.baseline_results: BETO for classification tasks showed weighted average F1-scores ranging from 0.672 to 0.793 across tasks.
methodology.validation: K-fold cross-validation was used for model evaluation.
